CyGutz tools¶

Initialization¶

init_ga.help()[source]¶

Print instructions.

init_ga.initialize()[source]¶

Initialization for the Gutzwiller/Slave-Boson solver. Store symmetry informations to init_ga_info.h5.

usrqa.inp_ga_init_dmft(soc_list, log)[source]¶

Generate the inputs for running ga_init_dmft.py.

usrqa.usr_qa_setup(material, log, usr_input)[source]¶

A list of questions to be answered to initialize the CyGutz job.

Material class¶

class myatom.myAtoms(symbols=None, positions=None, numbers=None, masses=None, magmoms=None, scaled_positions=None, cell=None, pbc=None)[source]¶

A class to describe the calculated system with all the relevant informations, such as coordinates, correlated atom indices, symmetry information, etc.

get_S_vector_list()[source]¶

Get S_vector_list in the working local basis.

get_myJ(basis)[source]¶

Get J vector in basis of ‘CH’ (complex harmonics) if spin-orbit interaction is neglected or ‘JJ’ (J^2-J_z basis) if spin-orbit interaction is present.

get_myLieParameters()[source]¶

Get the Lie parameters of rotation operators for odd and even J.

get_mySelfEnergy()[source]¶

Get the self-energy structure and the corresponding unitary transformation of the local basis.

set_1p_U_list(U_list)[source]¶

Save the one-particle unitary transformation from eithter CH (no spin-orbit) or JJ (with spin-orbit) to the basis used in the real calculation.

set_Mvec(Mvec_list)[source]¶

Set magnetization direction list.

Symmetry analysis¶

Atom Symmetry module

Input: 3D rotation group and a representation of J = [J_{x}, J_{y}, J_{z}] of an atom Output:

  1. A new representation of Jp and a unitary transformation U such that Jp = U^H J U
  2. A symbolic matrix representing a general matrix commuting with the representation of the group.
AtomSymmetry.check_Lie_parameters(G, J, Lie_parameters)[source]¶

Check the representation generated by Lie parameters and J with G.

AtomSymmetry.check_Lie_parameters_3D(Rotations, Lie_parameters)[source]¶

Compare the 3D rotation matrices with the one generated by Lie parameters and the generator J.

AtomSymmetry.check_commute_sigma_J(sigma, J, Rotations)[source]¶

Check the commutation of sigma with the new rotated representation.

AtomSymmetry.check_strcture_constants(J, Jp)[source]¶

Compare the structure constants between two sets of generators.

AtomSymmetry.get_JR_representation(Rotations, J)[source]¶

Get the representation of {R} using generator {J}.

AtomSymmetry.get_Lie_from_JR(Rotations, J)[source]¶

Get the Lie parameters of {R}.

AtomSymmetry.get_Lie_parameter_3D(g, plus2pi=False)[source]¶

Get Lie parameter from a 3D rotation matrix.

AtomSymmetry.get_Lie_parameters(Rotations, plus2pi=False)[source]¶

Get Lie parameters for a 3D rotation group.

AtomSymmetry.get_U_Jnew(list_chi_space, list_chi_U, reorder=True)[source]¶

Reorder basis to get nice block form.

AtomSymmetry.get_U_equiv_repr(representationA, representationB)[source]¶

Get the transformation matrix U such that B= UAU^H.

AtomSymmetry.get_atom_Jnew(Rotations, J)[source]¶

Main function.

AtomSymmetry.get_characters_espace(representation, V)[source]¶

Get the character (vector) of one eigen-space defined by V.

AtomSymmetry.get_chi_repr(list_chi, list_repr, list_eigen_space)[source]¶

Group the equivalent (chi) representations.

AtomSymmetry.get_eigen_space(H, tol=0.0001)[source]¶

Get eigen spaces of a Hermitian matrix H.

AtomSymmetry.get_plus2pi(Jz)[source]¶

Decide whether one needs to double the number of Lie parameters due to half-integer of J.

AtomSymmetry.get_product_table(R_list)[source]¶

Get product table of the representation.

AtomSymmetry.get_ratio_matab(a, b)[source]¶

Get a scale ratio of two matrix.

AtomSymmetry.get_rotation(J, theta, method='eigh')[source]¶

Get rotation matrix by Lie parameters and generator J.

AtomSymmetry.get_seq_matrix(N)[source]¶

Generate a square matrix with sequential elements.

AtomSymmetry.get_structure_constants(J)[source]¶

Get the structure constant or commutation table of [Jx,Jy,Jz].

AtomSymmetry.locate_R_list(R01, R_list)[source]¶

Locate the R in R_list.

AtomSymmetry.sym_matrix(X, R_list)[source]¶

Symmetrize matrix X.

Multiplets analysis¶

Tools to analyse the local many-body density matrix (multiplets).

multiplets_analysis.get_local_histogram(imp, f, num_ev=0, Rpr_list=None)[source]¶

Get the local histogram with labels.

multiplets_analysis.get_rho_histogram(rho, ID_block, N=None, J=None, num_ev=0, Rpr_list=None)[source]¶

Get the histogram of the local density matrix with labels.

Embeding Hamiltonian¶

embed_test.get_D_term(D, c)[source]¶

Get D (cross) terms.

embed_test.get_Lc_term(Lc, c)[source]¶

Get Lc (auxillary) terms.

embed_test.get_R(c, gs)[source]¶

Get the R-matrix.

embed_test.get_one_body_term(t, c)[source]¶

Get local one-body terms.

embed_test.get_phy_nssp(c, gs)[source]¶

Get < c^{dagger} c>_G.

embed_test.get_two_body_term(U, c)[source]¶

Get local two-body terms.

embed_test.get_var_nssp(c, gs)[source]¶

Get < c^{dagger} c>_G.

embed_test.test_embed(param_file, op_file)[source]¶

Test the embedding formalism.

Impurity analysis¶

impurity_analysis.get_d11_sb()[source]¶

Get <n_{1, up} n_{1, dn}>_{G}

impurity_analysis.get_ed_d_occ_1()[source]¶

Get double occupancy of the first (correlated) site.

impurity_analysis.get_n12_ed()[source]¶

Get <c^{dagger}_{1, up} c_{2, up}>.

impurity_analysis.get_n12_sb()[source]¶

Get <c^{dagger}_{1, up} c_{2, up}>_{G}

impurity_analysis.get_w0_sb(num_spin_orbital)[source]¶

Get W^{0}_{R, Psi}

impurity_analysis.get_w1_sb(num_spin_orbital)[source]¶

Get W^{1}_{R, Psi}
